original_text: John Lewis actions inspired many, in the US & around the world, who have had to stand up to situations of injustices of different kinds. May his legacy continue to inspire generations to have the courage to face injustice with #goodtrouble. My condolences to his family&loved ones

Tested as we've been by the oddest of the odds & learned from what has been endured as a pple lacking no commitment to shape our better future,surely who has the time to be scared of or defeated by the odds that still lie ahead of us! Our young pple just have to do better than us

I hope & have been promising myself that with the help of colleagues in RPF (like in everything else as we did..) I'll be able to frame it in as much detail of interpretation&fact as I can in a book or other form(s). I shall find time. It'll be a way of doing justice to the cause

The struggle and History of all this is by far too complex,deeper and wider than some pple wish to imagine or portray it to be hence even more pile up of injustice,prejudice & gross misrepresentation of the truth. Still it remains ours to carry and deal with!

Every year of the last 26,this day 4 July, many pple& I am no exception take stock in equal measure of the unimaginable  losses&gains& progress(made so far) by our country owing to the sacrifices by the gallant men & women of this our beloved Nation. To all I can only salute!!!
This is to wish my friend @AUC_MoussaFaki ,all the best on his BIrth Day. A good coincidence that today is also a Father's Day. God Bless

Had a call with PM @JustinTrudeau and thanked him for Canadaâ€™s strong partnership with Rwanda and Africa, and support against #COVID19 and toward @AIMS_Next and for the Africa Center of Excellence for Children Peace and Security. Moving stronger together.

original_text:
On behalf of Gov't and my own behalf I sent our condolences to the Gov't and People of Burundi for the passing of President Nkurunziza. This also goes to the family of the President.
God Bless!

Had a very good call with my friend PM @narendramodi. We discussed our historically good relationship and the support India continues to offer us. I thanked him for the medical supplies&equipments India donated to Rwanda in this fight against #Covid19. It is very much appreciated

Had a very productive conversation with EU Commissioner for International Partnerships @JuttaUrpilainen, in the context of the strong collaboration between the EU and Rwanda. Appreciated the EUâ€™s continuous and needed support in the fight against #COVID19 pandemic, among others.

As we celebrate #AfricaDayÂ ,these challenging times remind each of us that our collective well-being, prosperity and dignity will only be achieved through unity of purpose. Thank you to Chairperson @CyrilRamaphosa and @AUC_MoussaFaki for their leadership towards #TheAfricaweWant
#EidMubarak to all our brothers and sisters celebrating in Rwanda and around the world. Wishing all of you a blessed and safe Eid al-fitr.

Had a very good conversation with @ClarenceHouse HRH Prince Charles on his Sustainable Markets Initiative. Rwanda looks forward to being part of this timely&important initiative. Global support will be key in rebuilding more sustainable&smart economies as we recover from #COVID19

Here we are having to deal with #COVID19 situation & the devastation caused by heavy rains/floods,same time washing away bridges & roads in hundreds of places across the country. Even over this we shall prevail!! https://t.co/QTaNlvoTZj

I just had a good conversation with President @realDonaldTrump. We discussed our good relationship, and the support he personally, and his administration are extending to Rwanda to combat the #COVID19 pandemic. This was much appreciated. https://t.co/ATF00dTYek

Thank you for the good conversation @KerstiKaljulaid. Joining our digital efforts and continuous collaboration across sectors will be key to ending the spread of #COVID19 and facing the realities that await us all when the pandemic comes to an end.

Visited the #COVID19 Command Post where our professionals are working hard to end the spread of the virus and for Rwandans to return to our normal lives. We thank each member of the team and all health workers across the country for your selfless service to your nation.

Thank you for your kind wishes & always standing in solidarity w/ Rwanda as we remember victims of the Genocide against the Tutsi:@antonioguterres, @AbiyAhmedAli,@SahleWorkZewde,@AUC_MoussaFaki,@eucopresident,@LMushikiwabo,@AnnLinde,@romeodallaire,@Atayeshe,@JimInhofe,@JaredCohen

original_text: Together, we shall prevail in this fight against #COVID19
This afternoon I had a call with my brother and friend HH @TamimBinHamad I thank you very much for reaching out and the msg of support & solidarity for my country and our people regarding #COVID19.

As always, we will overcome these difficult times through solidarity and working together. This will require the discipline Rwandans have always shown in confronting challenges and getting good results.

Washing hands frequently, avoiding handshakes, practicing social distancing of at least 1m away from people, among others. We urge everyone to follow the health guidelines (supported by science and best management practices): https://t.co/gAwo6Emzfj.
Rwanda has registered its first #COVID19 case. As emphasized by others, panic in this situation does not help. Focus and simple but effective measures are key to keeping each other and everyone safe.

As the world faces the #COVID19 pandemic, our thoughts and prayers are with the victims, families and their loved ones.We wish strength to the health workers on the frontlines & quick recovery to all patients. Thank you @DrTedros and @WHO for your leadership in these trying times

Nkuko bisanzwe, tuzatsinda muri ibi bihe bikomeye binyuze mu bufatanye no gukorera hamwe. Ibi biradusaba kwitwararika twakomeje kwerekana nkâ€™abanyarwanda mu bihe byose twahanganye nâ€™ibibazo kandi tukagera ku musaruro mwiza.

Gukaraba intoki kenshi, kwirinda kuramukanya, kwirinda kujya ahantu hateraniye abantu benshi kandi tugahagarara ahitaruye, nâ€™ibindi. Turakangurira buri wese gukurikiza amabwiriza ajyanye no kubungabunga ubuzima (nkuko imigenzo myiza yo kwirinda ibyibutsa): https://t.co/gAwo6EEa6R

Mu Rwanda hamaze kugaragara umuntu wa mbere wanduye #COVID19. Nkuko byakomeje kuvugwa, kugira impagarara muri ibi bihe ntacyo byadufasha. Ingamba zisobanutse kandi zihamye nizo shingiro ryo gukomeza kwirinda ikwirakwiza ryâ€™icyi cyorezo.

Ubwo isi yugarijwe nâ€™icyorezo cya #COVID19, tuzirikane abo imaze kuvutsa ubuzima, imiryango yabo nâ€™inshuti zabo. Duteye ingabo mu bitugu abakora mu nzego zâ€™ubuzima, kandi twifurije abayirwaye bose gukira vuba. Turashimira @DrTedros na @WHO bakomeje kutugenda imbere muri ibi bihe.

Whenever women gain,we all gain as a country. There can be no true progress without equality. Thank you for playing your rightful and equal role in Rwandaâ€™s transformation. Happy International Womenâ€™s Day to our sisters,mothers & daughters in Rwanda and across the world. #IWD2020

Thank you @Amref_Worldwide for this recognition, on my behalf and on behalf of the people of Rwanda. We owe this progress to partners like you who have joined forces with us in our journey to deliver a dignified and healthy life for all Rwandans.
@YPO @YPOEdge .... being with you tomorrow.
@YPO @YPOEdge Thank you very much! Looking forward too.

I was happy that President of Mali,my brother Ibrahim Boubacar KeÃ¯ta,also participated- our African Union Champion of Culture Heritage. This important mission could not be in better hands. #FESPACO2019

Thank you my brother and friend @rochkaborepf for honouring Rwanda at this meaningful celebration of our African culture. Congratulations to all the winners of the competition and all featured artists. We wish you continued success. #FESPACO2019
@rochkaborepf Thank you my brother and friend @rochkaborepf for your warm welcome and hospitality. It is a pleasure to be back in the land of Upright Men and Women.

I congratulate H.E. President @Macky_Sall on your re-election and the trust the people of Senegal have placed in you. We are committed to working with you and the people of Senegal as you carry forward your vision of national transformation.

Congratulations H.E. President @MBuhari on your re-election. We look forward to building even stronger ties between Rwanda and Nigeria, and to working together as you continue to lead your country towards prosperity and success.
I warmly congratulate our new Chair, my brother President Sisi of Egypt. You have my full support as you take our Union to greater heights
Africa is moving even faster towards fulfilling the aspirations of our citizens. The progress we have made together toward #TheAfricaWeWant is irreversible.

Congratulations to His Excellency Maj. Gen. (Rtd) Evariste Ndayishimye, who was sworn-in today as President of Burundi, following the massive victory of the CNDD-FDD party in elections held on May 20th, 2020. https://t.co/jxTQy0ukGb

My condolences to the people of Burundi, on the demise of H.E President Pierre Nkurunziza who died earlier in the week.
May his soul rest in peace. https://t.co/teXKkJgICj

On regional relations, Uganda has built capacity to offer support when called upon by any of our brotherly neighbours. In Uganda, those who tried to destabilise our security through criminal activities have been defeated. https://t.co/40mgHb1cwZ

I must reiterate the most important point of the moment in our country. Coronavirus can be defeated through discipline, vigilance and enforcement of the guidelines given by the scientists. This is not just a matter of policing, its about your life as Ugandans. https://t.co/2pv1K9WgHH

I am still concerned about our tax:GDP ratio, which at 14% is still very low. Part of the problem has been collusion at URA to aid tax evasion. We have now cleaned URA and will do so with other agencies. https://t.co/AfZKMQqzf9
The Uganda Development Bank is finally an operational address for low interest rates for our manufacturers in agriculture, ICT, services and manufacturing (including agro-processing).

I am optimistic about the future, since the little we have done has sustained us in the shutdown period. 
Our strategies are starting to pay off now.

The figures you heard from the minister in regards to our growth in the last financial year are a reflection of our potential to keep growing despite the myriad of challenges in the last half of the year. https://t.co/Yw506H3ooC

This afternoon at State House Entebbe, through a technology platform, I participated in the presentation of the national budget to Parliament. 
I congratulate the Minister of Finance and all who braved the small problem of the rain to deliver on this important task. https://t.co/gLzu1cqMVg

This afternoon, at 2pm, the Minister of Finance, the Hon. Matia Kasaija, will deliver the 2020/21 National Budget on my behalf to Parliament. Thereafter, I will digitally address MPs and the country. https://t.co/r2hskUlkqQ

To my comrades in the struggle, both living and departed (including Maj. Gen. Kasirye Gwanga who passed on this morning and Najwa Abbas who passed on recently in Sudan), the struggle continues and victory is certain. https://t.co/MtGHckFWI1

Away from the COVID-19 pandemic, our biggest challenge remains corruption. This nonsense in public service and government parastatals requires a concerted effort and we shall defeat it. To hell with parasitism. https://t.co/QXpGJQxkMU

The truck drivers were a big contributor to our cases but the interventions we took are helping reduce these specific cases. The distribution of masks will start tomorrow and I have asked the authorities to prepare hospital facilities to handle upto 40,000 cases if we get there. https://t.co/hpWKvoGpiu

As we ease the "lockdown" measures, you have been provided with careful and deliberate guidance by the government. However, it is disheartening to see some people blatantly flout these guidelines. https://t.co/yWCRtVmWGJ

Today, we are confronted by an enemy worse than the war of bullets that we fought. It is a biological war and the value of discipline cannot be over-emphasised. Without a cure or vaccine for Covid-19, it is our personal discipline that matters most. https://t.co/Muv12R7JTM
The success of our struggle as embodied by the martyrs of Kikandwa was based on appreciation of the cause, commitment to it and the discipline to execute that cause. https://t.co/UZ32pmUw12

We celebrate our heroes on June 9th because on that day, in 1981, the Obote government executed nine of our supporters in Kikandwa Village, Nakaseke District. The day, however, symbolizes our memory of all other heroes who died at different times. https://t.co/t0zq9Aa0Ae

At State House Entebbe, I presided over the "scientific" celebrations of our Heroes Day, whose theme focused on celebrating the selflessness of our heroes who put country before self. https://t.co/CuJXpdWGrX

A happy Heroes Day to all Ugandans. I will address the country this morning as we mark this important day, paying tribute to those whose sacrifice is the foundation for our country's stability and development.
My full speech for the just-concluded State of the Nation Address can be obtained here: https://t.co/qvuISW0lyK
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, I will digitally deliver the State of the Nation Address to Parliament from Entebbe State House shortly. https://t.co/BtikSTbNCa
Launching operations for Dei Bio- Pharma Industries in Kigogwa, Matuga. https://t.co/zAFClK48Ee

I congratulate the founding director Mathias Magoola, for the spirit of freedom fighting. He has suffered more from the hands of those meant to support him. My visit to the facility was therefore partly aimed at morale-boosting him and his team. https://t.co/aYwBpKuIcN

The founders of Dei Group, which oversees the Pharmaceutical also donated a brand new Double Cabin pick-up truck, and 7 tonnes of maize flour to the National COVID-19 taskforce. https://t.co/vYQ4Er2Mnx

Together with Speaker @RebeccaKadagaUG, we toured and launched operations for Dei Bio- Pharma Industries in Kigogwa, Matuga. These will manufacture essential quality medicines in a range of therapeutic areas with a special emphasis on malaria. https://t.co/xfqDNs1bHB
I will deliver the State of the Nation Address tomorrow, Thursday, at 2pm. https://t.co/hiXVhGC0DS

God can hear our prayers from anywhere and His blessings upon our lives are boundless (Psalms 139:7-8).  Let us continue worshiping from our homes. We continue to lift our nation in prayer and ask for Godâ€™s protection of all Ugandans against COVID-19 

Happy #MartyrsDay. https://t.co/S6qMnr2mDu

We have the capacity to produce many things here because we have the raw materials. We have injected money in Uganda Development Bank to support manufacturers with low interest loans and enhance production. https://t.co/JzUBsulVis

Commissioned Lida Packaging Products Limited in Mbalala, Mukono District. This company has a production capacity of 560,000 masks per day and is currently employing 315 Ugandan youth with more expected. https://t.co/EkWZaA8pze
There is 'nothing' there now! https://t.co/xJCar4KEea

Dear Muslim Brothers and Sisters, 
I am confident that you have emerged from this period of abstinence spiritually rejuvenated and fortified.

I wish you and your families a joyous and blessed celebration - Eid Mubarak. https://t.co/VmUGJftr4c

On my way from Jinja, I made a stopover at the New Nile bridge, it is a marvel! The last time I was here, we had a problem with the moving island, it has since been cleared and the water flow normalized. https://t.co/NTTPZaFbLG

Later, I delivered a lecture of opportunity to the students at the Uganda Senior Command and Staff College, Kimaka. The lecture focused on three key issues;  Ideology, strategy, and tactics. https://t.co/HlESQEXwxw
I salute the Indian political class for working with us and the Indian Association of Uganda for contributing to building Uganda through business and investment. https://t.co/hgQLtp0ijD

We are very happy to be associated with the Indian army which has a lot of knowledge, experience, and heroism. The heroic Indians are the ones who stopped the westward expansion of Japan at the famous battle of Kohima. https://t.co/FgJQTmM78h

I thank the army, the training teams, and the Indian Association of Uganda who mobilized to build this center. It is a great gesture of the wider cooperation and support we enjoy with the government and the people of India. https://t.co/tizhwSVULL
Commissioning the wargame centre at the Uganda Senior Command and Staff College in Kimaka, Jinja District. This centre will contribute to the quality of training for our army. https://t.co/KnAIVYImk1
I met with the National Council of Elders to discuss some matters of national importance. https://t.co/My7yLzNXzY

While departing to Kasese District earlier today, I also took a quick inspection of our bombardier CRJ 900 planes. The tourism sector continues to be shut down due to the ban on international travel, but I am optimistic we shall have a boom when we defeat the virus. https://t.co/VWAUPFAejB
In case, you missed or did not fully follow the televised address where I made clarifications to certain measures on easing lockdown, you can access the full text here: https://t.co/fu0fsANsoh

On my way to Kasese District for an assessment tour of the damage caused by recent floods.  I will also address a select group of leaders in the district on possible long term solutions. https://t.co/g70ArFkuXw
It was a very fruitful engagement. I thank Your Excellency for the time. We look forward to defeating this pandemic and strengthening ties between our two countries. https://t.co/EGpNEL2Cii
The measures to ease lockdown as addressed today will be activated only when each individual has received a standard mask distributed by the government of Uganda. https://t.co/l5edCCDhZP

The government will provide standard masks to all Ugandans aged 6 years and above, these will be distributed through the District Local Council system. Each person will be allocated one mask which must be worn all the time when in public. https://t.co/6Z4NEQBwpm

Hence, if each individual can consume about 250gs of the relief Posho per meal, you can obtain enough calories to enable you to considerably survive for quite some time.  The food should not be consumed wastefully. https://t.co/USxMqMnKti

The scientific conclusion we have arrived at is that 250gs of Posho is optimal for consumption in this situation, this means that for 2.6kgs of posho, about 10 days are possible. https://t.co/a1LF7BP1ak

I asked the kitchen staff to prepare 1kg of the maize flour from the food being distributed by the COVID-19 relief team. My intention was to understand how an individual can consume this food optimally during this period. https://t.co/FAQmefRysk

In addition to washing hands [with soap], using sanitiser and keeping social distance, it is important that you wear masks when in public. 
Together we will defeat #COVID19 https://t.co/bzmTe2iGju

I am sharing with you a sermon I delivered on Easter Sunday as I held "scientific" prayers with my family. Its core theme is how man should dominate nature. God bless you. https://t.co/EryBi6nSsa https://t.co/i9KN4Tasjp

To the mothers of Uganda, I join others in celebrating you today. Thank you for being the bedrock of our country.

To the other Ugandans, especially the Bazukulu, I wish you a blessed Sunday.

Our strategy is to limit the number of COVID-19 positive cases to a manageable one; prohibit its spread, as we wait for the vaccine. However, I also believe that God helps those who help themselves. https://t.co/8ye81EXUN4

Nimesikitishwa na kifo cha Mzee wetu Balozi (Mst) Job Lusinde. Nawapa pole Familia, wana Dodoma na Watanzania. Nitaukumbuka mchango wake mkubwa kwa Taifa akiwa Waziri, Balozi, Mdhamini wa CCM na Kiongozi wa Wazee wa Dodoma. Pumzika salama Mtani wangu, kazi kubwa umeifanya vizuri.

Today, the World Bank has declared Tanzania Middle Income Country. In this regard, I congratulate all my compatriots for this historic achievement. We had envisaged to achieve this status by 2025 but,with strong determination, this has been possible in 2020. GOD BLESS TANZANIA.

Benki ya Dunia leo tarehe 01 Julai, 2020 imeitangaza Tanzania kuingia UCHUMI WA KATI.Nawapongeza Watanzania wenzangu kwa mafanikio haya.Huu ni ushindi mkubwa na kazi kubwa tumeifanya, tulipanga kuingia uchumi wa kati ifikapo 2025 lakini tumefanikiwa 2020.MUNGU IBARIKI TANZANIA

Nakupongeza Dkt. Lazarus Chakwera kwa kuchaguliwa kuwa Rais wa Jamhuri ya Malawi. Kwa niaba ya Serikali na Watanzania wote naahidi kuendeleza uhusiano wetu wa kidugu, kirafiki na ujirani mwema hususani katika masuala ya uchumi na ustawi wa jamii.
Hongera sana Mhe. Rais.

Nimeshtushwa na taarifa za kifo cha Rais wa Burundi, Mhe. Pierre Nkurunziza. Nitamkumbuka kwa uongozi wake imara na juhudi zake za kupigania amani, maendeleo na kuruhusu demokrasia. Kwa niaba ya Serikali na Watanzania nawapa pole familia na Warundi wote. Mungu amweke mahali pema.

Nakupongeza Ndg. Evariste Ndayishimiye kwa kuchaguliwa kuwa Rais wa Burundi. Wananchi wa Burundi wameonesha imani kubwa kwako. Kwa niaba ya Serikali na Watanzania wote naahidi kuendeleza uhusiano mzuri kati yetu. Nawatakia Warundi wote amani na ujenzi bora wa Taifa lenu.
